subject: AI
title: Calling Your First AI API
description: Make your first API call to a large language model and get a response.

hook.text: One HTTP request. One JSON body. One response that can write poetry, code, or business plans.

buildup.text: Every AI API call follows the same shape: endpoint URL, authentication header, messages array, and model parameters.

discovery.text: Send a messages array with a system prompt and a user message. The model returns a completion with the assistant's response.

twist.text: API calls aren't instant â€” they can take 1-30 seconds depending on the model and prompt length. Always handle timeouts.

climax.text: Your first successful API response feels like magic. You've just given your app a brain.

punchline.text: Every AI product in the world started with one API call. You just made yours.

quiz.question: What is the typical structure of an LLM API request?
options: A messages array with system and user messages
